author: Utah State University
title: USU Blanding Instructor Using Power of Stories to Connect Students and Course Material
text: USU Blanding Instructor Using Power of Stories to Connect Students and Course Material By [Marcus Jensen](mailto:marcus.jensen@usu.edu) | BLANDING, Utah ‚Äî A Utah State University Blanding professor is using the power of stories to help connect her students to the material they are learning. Josi Russell, an associate professor of English in the [College of Humanities and Social Sciences](https://chass.usu.edu/index.php), uses what she calls ‚Äústory-based course design,‚Äù which allows her students the chance to personally engage with course content, rather than just listen to it. ‚ÄúStory-based course design frames course material as a narrative in which the student participates in the course as a character,‚Äù Russell said. ‚ÄúIn a story-based course, students step inside the material to take charge of the course instead of just taking it. They take on the role of explorers rather than observers.‚Äù Throughout her teaching career, which began in 2001, Russell has had to adapt her method of teaching. Many of her courses are taught completely online, which adds to the challenge of engaging students. Russell believes that online education can be just as fulfilling and engaging as face-to-face learning, if it is developed deliberately and infused with creativity. She developed her teaching style to better adapt to online learners. ‚ÄúI learned how quickly a learner can disengage when staring at a monitor. So I began to adapt,‚Äù Russell said. ‚ÄúBack in 2013, I began experimenting with ways to expand the borders of my classroom and found the new generation of learners was highly responsive to more engaging courses with more online content.‚Äù Russell is a published author, having published more than 20 novels, as well as short stories. With this unique lens, Russell feels strongly that story-based teaching has strong potential for students in leveraging the power of stories to engage learners. By allowing students to immerse themselves in a course and become a part of the content, she has seen strong engagement from her online students. ‚ÄúI felt that students would engage more fully if they could see themselves as part of a story ‚Äî epic heroes or travelers on a quest ‚Äî so I redesigned my classes to be immersive experiences that would help students step inside the content,‚Äù she said. I didn‚Äôt want them to simply take my course, I wanted them to take ownership of it.‚Äù In her English 2220 course ‚ÄúIntroduction to Fiction‚Äù, Russell has designed the class as a ‚ÄúChoose Your Own Adventure Story,‚Äù complete with wrong turns, foes to be vanquished and quests to be undertaken. As they navigate the story, students read seven novels and learning about different genres and features of fiction. Students face challenges where they can earn gold coins to be used on hard questions or special objects to help then through their quest. All their assignments are framed as conversations between themselves and various characters in the story. The students are cast as the heroes of the story. ‚ÄúWhen the student is the hero of the story, the power dynamic of the classroom changes,‚Äù Russell said. ‚ÄúThe professor becomes a guide and observer as students strike out on their own quest for knowledge, driven not by the threat of failure, but by the magical lure of discovery and adventure.‚Äù In her English 1010 course, students engage in a ‚Äúrace around the world‚Äù journey, stepping into different cultures and communities. And in English 2010, Russell casts students as designers, architects and problem-solvers who create a library and fill it with resources for a particular community. After redesigning her courses, Russell has seen a spike in positive feedback and student engagement. Russell found that the COVID pandemic further led to students fatiguing with content that was impersonal, flat or unengaging. She believes that her method can help students continue to engage while taking charge of their own learning. She recently shared this teaching method as part of her presentation at the 2023 [Empowering Teaching Excellence Conference.](https://digitalcommons.usu.edu/ete_conf/2023/all/32/) In this presentation, Russell shared her own journey of recrafting her courses, then shared a six-step process for other educators to craft story-based courses, regardless of the subject matter they teach. ‚ÄúThis is a new way of teaching and a new way of learning,‚Äù Russell said. ‚ÄúI find things to improve every semester. My willingness to take risks and try something new seems to also free my students to innovate and experiment. I am proud of the fact that my classes ask students to step boldly into the adventure of their own education.‚Äù Word of mouth has been strong for Russell‚Äôs courses, as she routinely has a wait-list for students who want to take her courses, with many classes having a waitlist of more than 50 students. Offering residential campus housing and dining, Utah State University Blanding gives students the personalized attention and small class sizes of a small-town college with the resources of a large university, all while providing award-winning education. With degree options ranging from associate to doctorate degrees, plus technical education offerings in Business, Technical Trades and Health Professions, USU Blanding offers programs that help fuel local economies and empower individuals and their communities. Learn more at [blanding.usu.edu](https://statewide.usu.edu/blanding/). WRITER Marcus Jensen News Coordinator University Marketing and Communications [marcus.jensen@usu.edu](mailto:marcus.jensen@usu.edu) CONTACT Josi Russell Associate Professor of English USU Blanding [josi.russell@usu.edu](mailto:josi.russell@usu.edu) TOPICS [Statewide Campuses 326stories](/today/topics/statewide-campuses) [Teaching 148stories](/today/topics/teaching) [Humanities 111stories](/today/topics/humanities) Comments and questions regarding this article may be directed to the contact person listed on this page.

author: MENAFN
title: British priests riot against Vatican due to gay marriage blessings | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN ) In response to the recent landmark ruling by Pope Francis allowing priests to issue blessings to same-sex couples under specific conditions, a group of British priests has released an open letter reaffirming the "unchangeable" teachings of the Catholic Church. The Vatican's doctrinal office issued a document on Monday, stating that Roman Catholic priests could choose to provide blessings to same-sex couples on a "case-by-case basis," emphasizing that this process does not supersede the sacrament of heterosexual marriage and cannot occur during regular church rituals or liturgy.
The letter, signed by around 500 priests from the UK's Confraternity of Catholic Clergy and released on Thursday, seeks to address what it describes as "widespread confusion" following the Vatican's decree. The priests express their commitment to upholding the traditional values of the Church, emphasizing that these values remain "unchanged and unchangeable."
While acknowledging the Vatican's perspective that such blessings reflect God's welcoming of all individuals, the British priests argue that providing blessings to same-sex couples would be perceived as a form of approval. The letter contends that there is no situation in which such blessings could be adequately distinguished from some level of approval, deeming them "pastorally and practically inadmissible."
The article explores the concerns raised by the British priests, delving into the evolving dynamics within the Catholic Church regarding LGBTQ+ issues. It examines the impact of the Vatican's decision on the global Catholic community and the ongoing dialogue between traditional teachings and the calls for more inclusive practices within the Church.
MENAFN24122023000045015687ID1107652562
Legal Disclaimer:
MENAFN provides the information ‚Äúas is‚Äù without warranty of any kind. If you have any complaints or copyright issues related to this article, kindly contact the provider above.

author: Daniel Royte
title: Following Twitch Expos√© Drama, Asmongold Takes Responsibility After Being Accused For Imminent Adpocalyse on Platform
text:
In recent weeks, Twitch has been filled with debates about content moderation and advertising policies. And at the center of it all are Asmongold and HasanAbi. Dubbed the ‚Äú adpocalypse ,‚Äù this wave of demonetization has left many creators and viewers questioning the platform‚Äôs future.
Hasan blames Asmon and the people he collaborates with. | Image Credit: @HasanAbi/YouTube Hasan has blamed fellow content creator Asmon for the so-called Twitch adpocalypse, which is now oddly simlar to YouTube‚Äôs advertiser fallout in 2016-2017. Known for his outspoken criticism of the platform‚Äôs policies, Asmon responded candidly, accepting partial responsibility for the issue. Is this the first step of a domino effect that leads to the platform downfall?
Asmongold Doesn‚Äôt Disagree With Hasan, But It‚Äôs Much Deeper Than That Asmon agrees that some of it is on him. | Image Credit: @asmongold/YouTube The drama began with FaZe Kaysan, who revealed that his Twitch channel had been demonetized for using the ‚ÄòIran‚Äô tag in his streams. Other creators, such as BigEx, also faced similar situations for using tags like ‚ÄòVenezuela‚Äô.
im about to go live right now, i just found out i was demonetized on twitch for representing my country venezuela, for the past month i didnt make a single penny on ads‚Ä¶ i have had venezuela in my tags for the longest‚Ä¶ this is absurd im missing thousands of dollars.
‚Äî Ex üåü (@ExSZN) November 13, 2024 Hasan linked these incidents to Asmongold, attributing it to his criticisms of the platform‚Äôs moderation practices. Hasan says that Asmon threatening to reveal the moderation team‚Äôs biases has played a role in alienating advertisers.
üö®Asmongold responds to Hasanabi Blaming Him For Twitch Adpocalypse also calls out Frogan,Denims, and others for taking No AccountabiltyüëÄ
"The issue is that people are not taking accountability for the bad things that they're doing, and they're trying to pretend like they're‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/T4ZWvnQYqw
‚Äî Bestfriend (@BestfriendKick) November 13, 2024 Asmon did not shy away from the accusations. Addressing Hasan‚Äôs comments, he noted that he might have contributed to the so-called adpocalypse. ‚Äú I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs entirely my fault, but some of it definitely is ,‚Äù he told his viewers.
Related ‚ÄúThrowing people under the bus doesn‚Äôt help your situation‚Äù: Dr Disrespect Exposing Twitch Streamers, Who Should‚Äôve Been Banned, Leaves a Bitter Taste in Fans‚Äô Mouths Talking about past controversies, including his own suspension for remarks about Palestinian culture, he emphasized the need for accountability. He criticized the platform for allowing ‚Äú double standards ‚Äù in content moderation.
FaZe Kaysan reveals that Twitch demonetized him, despite running ads and not being paid, because he had ‚ÄòIran‚Äô in his tags. Kaysan is originally from Iran üëÄ pic.twitter.com/rcyB8CrBau
‚Äî FearBuck (@FearedBuck) November 13, 2024 The financial impact of these controversies is already apparent. FaZe Kaysan and others have reported significant losses due to demonetization. Kaysan revealed that his use of the ‚ÄòIran‚Äô tag resulted in his inability to generate ad revenue, despite years of using the tag without issue.
Will This Be A YouTube 2.0 Situation? Where Does It Go From Here? Image Credit: Twitch The situation has been escalated after Asmon‚Äôs reaction to the recent controversy with Central_Committee, a political streamer. When the streamer was only issued a three-day ban, Asmon demanded stricter action, threatening to expose the platform ‚Äòs alleged biases.
Asmongold plans to do a stream exposing Twitch and its biased moderation team and says that if he gets banned for the expose, he‚Äôll move to Rumble or Kick üëÄ pic.twitter.com/glMsSghAzk
‚Äî FearBuck (@FearedBuck) November 13, 2024 The looming threat of an adpocalypse is concerning for the platform‚Äôs creators, especially those reliant on ad revenue. If the platform goes through a change like YouTube, creators producing edgy or politically charged material may face stricter restrictions or reduced income.
Related Johnny Somali‚Äôs Latest Crime Might Land Him in Korean Prison for 7 Years as Ex-Twitch Streamer F*cks Around and Finds Out The higher ups of the platform now stand at a crossroads. With calls for greater accountability and fairer moderation, the platform must balance the demands of its creators, viewers, and advertisers.
Asmon‚Äôs threat to expose further issues and with his willingness to move to rival platforms like Kick or Rumble shows just how bad the situation could become.
While Asmon and Hasan are on opposing ends of the situation, the call for action isn‚Äôt for either of them but for the platform itself. Now all we can do is wait for this situation to unfold.

author: Rodrigo Mozelli
title: Perseverance capta bela imagem panor√¢mica de Marte; veja!
text: O ve√≠culo espacial [Perseverance](https://olhardigital.com.br/2023/12/18/ciencia-e-espaco/perseverance-revela-novos-segredos-sobre-marte/), da [NASA](https://olhardigital.com.br/2024/01/05/ciencia-e-espaco/nasa-responde-objecao-de-nativos-a-levar-restos-mortais-para-lua/), capturou imagem panor√¢mica em 360¬∞ da regi√£o de Marte conhecida como Cratera Jezero, que j√° foi inundada de √°gua. Acredita-se que essa bacia seja local promissor para buscar evid√™ncias de vida extraterrestre. A imagem √© composta por 993 imagens individuais capturadas pelo instrumento Mastcam-Z do Perseverance ao longo de tr√™s dias em novembro de 2023. Leia mais: [Caracteres invis√≠veis no Instagram: para que servem e como usar?](https://olhardigital.com.br/2024/01/02/dicas-e-tutoriais/caracteres-invisiveis-no-instagram-para-que-servem-e-como-usar/) [Qual √© a origem dos nomes dos planetas do Sistema Solar?](https://olhardigital.com.br/2023/01/30/tira-duvidas/qual-e-a-origem-dos-nomes-dos-planetas-do-sistema-solar/) [NASA testa com sucesso motor de foguete da ‚Äòmiss√£o Marte‚Äô](https://olhardigital.com.br/2024/01/04/ciencia-e-espaco/motor-que-pode-levar-o-homem-para-marte-e-testado-pela-nasa/) Os editores fizeram alguns ajustes na imagem para aumentar o contraste e exagerar as diferen√ßas de cores, dando √† cena condi√ß√µes de ilumina√ß√£o semelhantes √†s da Terra. Em realidade, Marte parece mais escuro e avermelhado. Veja a imagem abaixo: Perseverance - O Perseverance pousou com sucesso na Cratera Jezero em 18 de fevereiro de 2021, juntamente com o helic√≥ptero rob√≥tico Ingenuity; - A miss√£o do Perseverance e do Ingenuity √© estudar o ambiente marciano rochoso e buscar evid√™ncias de que Marte j√° teve condi√ß√µes favor√°veis √† vida microbiana; - A Cratera Jezero √© local especialmente promissor porque os cientistas acreditam que ela era lago de 250 metros de profundidade preenchido com material org√¢nico h√° cerca de 3,5 bilh√µes de anos; - Em dezembro de 2023, o Perseverance comemorou seu mil√©simo dia marciano de miss√£o e os cientistas continuam recebendo novas descobertas. Marte em panorama Mesmo nesta √∫ltima imagem em 360¬∞, √© poss√≠vel encontrar evid√™ncias do passado turbulento de Marte e seu potencial para a vida microbiana. Diferentes camadas de rochas registram diferentes partes da hist√≥ria da cratera. O Curiosity, rover tamb√©m da NASA, segue trabalhando em Marte, mas em outra parte do planeta, chamada Monte Sharp. Recentemente, o Curiosity [capturou impressionante v√≠deo mostrando o progresso de dia marciano do anoitecer ao amanhecer](https://olhardigital.com.br/2023/12/29/ciencia-e-espaco/curiosity-rover-da-nasa-captura-cenas-de-um-dia-marciano-do-amanhecer-ao-anoitecer-assista/).

author: @laprensalatina
title: Israel continues offensive in Gaza, but medium-term plan unclear - La Prensa Latina Media
text: [Conflicts & War](https://www.laprensalatina.com/category/conflicts-war/) Israel continues offensive in Gaza, but medium-term plan unclear Jerusalem, Dec 28 (EFE). ‚Äì The Israeli army continued its offensive in the Gaza Strip on Thursday, where heavy fighting with Hamas continues, but despite Israel‚Äôs declaration that it is committed to the long term, the medium-term scenario of its offensive remains unclear. As Hamas disseminates videos showing its militias ambushing and attacking Israeli troops and tanks, the Israeli army continues to carry out operations in the north, center and south of the Strip. In the southern city of Khan Younis, Israeli forces carried out an ‚Äúunprecedented mission,‚Äù according to Defense Minister Yoav Gallant. ‚ÄúOur forces reach areas that we have never been before, taking over control rooms and eliminating terrorists,‚Äù said Gallant on Thursday. In turn, the troops intensified their military incursion in the southern area of the Strip, an operation they began weeks ago to reach the militia‚Äôs command centers and weapons depots. Gallant reiterated Israel‚Äôs intention to dismantle Hamas in order to hamper its military and governmental capabilities. At least 167 Israeli soldiers have died since the ground invasion of Gaza began on October 27, bringing the total number of soldiers ‚Äì active and reserve ‚Äì killed since the Hamas attack on October 7 to more than 500. Meanwhile, Israeli attacks and bombings have continued to claim Palestinian lives in recent hours. According to the Wafa news agency, dozens of Gazans died Thursday in bombings of homes in southern Gaza, an area where a large portion of the enclave‚Äôs 1.9 million internally displaced people are concentrated. In the town of Rafah, the southernmost point of the enclave, ‚Äúat least 20 citizens were killed and dozens injured as a result of an Israeli bombing that targeted a house,‚Äù it reported. Israeli warplanes also ‚Äútargeted a house in the Shaboura refugee camp‚Äù in Rafah, also causing ‚Äúdozens of deaths and injuries, most of them women and children,‚Äù said the news agency On the other hand, more than 25 people died in several attacks on Khan Yunis, reported the same source. Over 21,300 people have died in the two and a half months of the offensive, which has caused an unprecedented humanitarian crisis. The Israeli assault on Gaza has caused severe shortages of food, basic supplies, medicine, drinking water, and gasoline for electricity. Among other incidents, attacks were reported in the northern towns of Beit Hanun or Beit Lahia, including dozens of deaths, while Israeli troops continue to attack the Al Maghazi refugee camp in the city of Deir, which has been under almost constant bombardment in recent days. The medical services of the Palestinian Red Crescent reported that its teams transferred three dead and six wounded to the hospital after attacks on a house in the Al Maghazi camp. Their medical teams are also now working with the Egyptian Red Crescent to set up a camp for displaced people in the Khan Younis area, which is expected to reach 1,000 tents. All of this is happening while Israel is planning its medium-term actions in Gaza and a post-war plan that seems to be undecided at the moment, causing concern to its main ally, the United States. On Thursday, US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin spoke with Gallant and discussed aspects of the stabilization phase that must follow combat operations, according to the Pentagon. The White House is reportedly pressuring Israel to reduce the intensity of attacks on Gaza, although Gallant recently said they could continue for several months.

author: iheart.com
title: Tennessee Eatery Crowned The Best Mom & Pop Restaurant In The State | Talk Radio 98.3 WLAC
text:
Chain restaurants and popular eateries are great, but there's something about sitting down at a locally famous hole-in-the-wall or a longtime favorite mom and pop shop that has been serving up tried and true delicious meals for years that just hits home.
Using reviews, awards and accolades as well as first-hand experience, LoveFood compiled a list of the "best mom and pop restaurant" in every state, eateries that have been a mainstay of the community for decades or establishments that serve up family recipes that have been perfected over several generations.
According to the site, the best mom and pop restaurant in all of Tennessee is Sticky Rice Cafe, an eatery in Knoxville that serves up flavorful Laotian and Thai dishes. Sticky Rice Cafe , located at 120 Jack Dance Street, has a 4.7 star rating on Google and more than 1,600 reviews.
Here's what the site had to say about this restaurant offering "incredible comfort food":
"A Knoxville favorite, Sticky Rice Cafe serves up traditional Lao family recipes bursting with fresh, healthy ingredients and powerful, fragrant flavors. These are the type of dishes that make you feel warm and part of the family. Start with crab wontons and fried egg rolls before diving into a steaming bowl of fiery pho, loaded with your choice of protein (think seafood, chicken, pork belly, or tofu). Other highlights include seafood salad and the Phorrito (a tortilla stuffed with beef brisket, rice noodles, and veggies)." Check out the full list at lovefood.com to read up on more of the best mom and pop restaurants in the country.

author: @https://twitter.com/FOX13Memphis
title: Group carjacks woman in Cooper-Young, police say | News | fox13memphis.com
text:
Group carjacks woman in Cooper-Young, police say FOX13 Memphis News Staff FOX13 Memphis News Staff Author facebook Author twitter Author email Apr 25, 2024 1 hr ago Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Photo Credit: Memphis Police Department Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save MEMPHIS, Tenn. - A group of gunmen forced a woman to the ground and stole her car in Cooper-Young, according to the Memphis Police Department (MPD).
MPD said the woman was getting items out of the back seat of her 2019 Dodge Charger on New York Street when the group approached her around 11:40 p.m. on April 14.
One person with a gun demanded that she lay on the ground and then went through her pockets, MPD said. Another person got into the driver's side of her Charger and then both of the gunmen took off in the stolen car. MPD said a black Kia Soul sped away from the scene of the carjacking with them.
After stealing her possessions, MPD said the thieves used the woman's CashApp card at a corner store.
Six days after the carjacking, the group stole another car. MPD said that carjacking took place at Avalon and Monroe Avenue. This time, six gunmen ran up behind someone as they were getting into their 2018 Mercedes Benz G25. The gunmen forced the people out of the car, stole their cell phones purses and sped off, again followed by a black Kia Soul, according to MPD.
MPD released photos of the people wanted in connection to the carjackings. All face charges of aggravated robbery and aggravated assault.
If you have any idea who these people are, MPD urged you to call CrimeStoppers at 901-528-2274.

organizations.name: memphis news staff fox13 memphis news staff

title: Barbate recibe la Bandera Verde de Ecovidrio tras reciclar m√°s de 144.000 kilos de vidrio | El Peri√≥dico de Utrera. Noticias de Utrera
text: La Delegaci√≥n de Limpieza Viaria y RSU del Ayuntamiento de Barbate muestra su satisfacci√≥n por la obtenci√≥n de la Bandera Verde de Sostenibilidad de Ecovidrio, un reconocimiento que premia el esfuerzo colectivo por el reciclaje de envases de vidrio y el compromiso con el desarrollo sostenible. Barbate ha rivalizado con 46 municipios andaluces, consiguiendo un total de 2.325 puntos que le han colocado en tercer lugar en el ranking de municipios espa√±oles. Junto a Algeciras, que tambi√©n ha sido premiado con este importante galard√≥n, ha logrado una de las dos banderas que se otorgan en Andaluc√≠a, convirtiendo a la provincia de C√°diz en referente en reciclaje de vidrio. Esta puntuaci√≥n se ha logrado gracias al desarrollo de una campa√±a de comunicaci√≥n, difusi√≥n y concienciaci√≥n, que ha incluido diversas acciones encaminadas a informar e implicar a la ciudadan√≠a. Este reconocimiento llega tras meses de intenso trabajo en la campa√±a estival ‚ÄòBanderas Verdes‚Äô de Ecovidrio, en la que la Delegaci√≥n de Limpieza Viaria y RSU del Ayuntamiento de Barbate, que gestiona el edil Francisco Mu√±oz Jarillo, ha jugado un papel fundamental. Gracias a su implicaci√≥n, junto con el compromiso de los hosteleros, Barbate ha logrado superar el reto y alzarse con esta distinci√≥n que subraya su compromiso con el reciclaje de envases de vidrio. La campa√±a ‚ÄòMovimiento Banderas Verdes‚Äô de Ecovidrio ha contado este 2024 con la colaboraci√≥n de 116 bares, restaurantes y chiringuitos del t√©rmino municipal de Barbate, que han sido pieza clave para alcanzar este reconocimiento. De hecho, se ha logrado el reciclaje de un total de 144.500 kilos de vidrio durante los meses de junio, julio y agosto. ‚ÄúEl compromiso de la ciudadan√≠a en general ha sido esencial en la difusi√≥n de buenas pr√°cticas y en el impulso del reciclaje en el municipio, lo que ha permitido sumar los puntos necesarios para conseguir este prestigioso galard√≥n‚Äù, ha se√±alado el delegado de Limpieza Viaria y RSU del Ayuntamiento de Barbate, Francisco Mu√±oz Jarillo, quien ha destacado la gesti√≥n realizada para ‚Äúel refuerzo de la contenerizaci√≥n, la colocaci√≥n de los puntos de dep√≥sito y el trabajo de concienciaci√≥n y contacto con los hosteleros‚Äù. El edil ha expresado su satisfacci√≥n por la consecuci√≥n de este galard√≥n, se√±alando que ‚Äúesta Bandera Verde es una apuesta personal y una muestra clara de la implicaci√≥n de Barbate con el reciclaje‚Äù. ‚ÄúNuestro municipio ha demostrado, una vez m√°s, que est√° a la altura de los grandes retos medioambientales; este premio nos motiva a seguir trabajando para cuidar nuestro entorno y asegurar un futuro m√°s sostenible para todos‚Äù. Finalmente, Francisco Mu√±oz Jarillo ha felicitado al Ayuntamiento de Algeciras, a su alcalde, Jos√© Ignacio Landaluce, y a su concejal Javier V√°zquez Hueso, por conseguir tambi√©n la Bandera Verde de la Sostenibilidad de Ecovidrio. La entrega oficial de la Bandera Verde de Sostenibilidad tendr√° lugar el pr√≥ximo 30 de octubre en Madrid, en un acto organizado por Ecovidrio que reunir√° a los municipios ganadores a nivel nacional y que estar√° presidido por la Directora General de Pol√≠ticas Tur√≠sticas de la Secretar√≠a de Estado de Turismo, Ana Mu√±oz Llabr√©s.
